intro: Aster bodinieri, commonly known as the Chinese aster, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of purple, pink, and white. The plant typically grows to a height of 30 to 60 centimeters and prefers well-drained soil and full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are hairy and somewhat woody at the base. Aster bodinieri is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
